scheme

Class Scheme

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheme.Scheme

  • public class Scheme
extends java.lang.Object
    Class contains the implementation of Scheme, which can containts Blocks and Connections between these Blocks.
    Since:
    2017-04-28
    Author:
    Stupinský Šimon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      UniqueIdCreator blockGenerator
      Create Generator of UniqueID for the all Blocks
      java.util.Vector<Block> blocks
      Vector of the Blocks in the Scheme.
      java.util.Vector<Connection> connections
      Vector of the Connections between the Blocks in the Scheme.
      UniqueId ID
      UniqueID of the Scheme
      java.util.Vector<Block> initialBlocks
      Vector of Blocks, which can be calculating in the Scheme
      static UniqueIdCreator portGenerator
      Create Generator of UniquedID fot the all Ports

      Sets the flag of computation of the all Blocks in the Scheme to the false.

    • Method Detail

      • removeScheme

        public void removeScheme()
        Remove the actual Scheme, respectively creating the new empty Vectors of Blocks, Connections and generating new UniqueID for the Scheme.

      • addBlock

        public void addBlock(Block newBlock)
        Add block to the Vector of Blocks in the actual Scheme. If the Vector contains this block, will be replace.
        Parameters:
        newBlock - Block for added.

      • removeBlock

        public void removeBlock(Block newBlock)
        Remove the block from the Vector of Blocks in the actual Scheme. The relevant block will be set to the null, subsequently.
        Parameters:
        newBlock - Block for remove.

      • addConnection

        public void addConnection(Connection newConnection)
        Add connection to the Vector of Connection in the actual Scheme. If the Vector contains this connection, will be replace.
        Parameters:
        newConnection - Connection for added.

      • removeConnection

        public void removeConnection(Connection newConnection)
        Remove the connection from the Vector of Connections in the actual Scheme. The relevant connection will be set to the null, subsequently.
        Parameters:
        newConnection - Connection for remove.

      • findInitialBlocks

        public java.util.Vector<Block> findInitialBlocks()
        Method find the blocks, which have the all input ports without connection.
        Returns:
        Block with not connected input ports

      • findBlock

        public Block findBlock(UniqueId blockID)
        Find block according to the given UniqueID of the specific Block.
        Parameters:
        blockID - UniquedID of the specific Block
        Returns:
        Block with the same UniqueID if exists, else null.

      • findPort

        public Port findPort(UniqueId portID)
        Find port according to the given UniqueID of the specific Port.
        Parameters:
        portID - UniqueID of the specific Port
        Returns:
        Port with the same UniqueID if exists, else null.

      • findConnection

        public Connection findConnection(Port inputPort,
                                 Port outputPort)
        Find connection according to the given input and output Ports.
        Parameters:
        inputPort - input port of the finding connection
        outputPort - output port of the finding connection
        Returns:
        Connection contains these two Ports if exist, else false

      • findConnectedBlocks

        public java.util.Vector<Block> findConnectedBlocks(Block block)
        Find Block, which have the some connection with the given Block.
        Parameters:
        block - Block for which will be looking its connected blocks
        Returns:
        Vector of Blocks, which are connected to the given Block

      • checkInitPorts

        public boolean checkInitPorts(Block block)
        Check the input ports of the given Block. If the port is not connected with the other Port, value will be requested. In the case, when the Port is connected with some other Port, then must be computed Block with this connected Port before it.
        Parameters:
        block - Block for execution the check
        Returns:
        True if all input port are ready, else false

      • resetComputed

        public void resetComputed()
        Sets the flag of computation of the all Blocks in the Scheme to the false. This actions is executing after the finish of each run of computation.

      • calcblock

        public int calcblock(Block block)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Execution the actions needed to computation the given Port, respectively computation of each formula in this Block.
        Parameters:
        block - Block for computation.
        Returns:
        UniqueID of computed Block
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - FormulaException

      • computeAllScheme

        public void computeAllScheme()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Execution the calculation of the all Blocks in the Scheme.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - FormulaException

      • detectionLoop

        public void detectionLoop()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Detetion Loop betweem the individual Block in the Scheme with using the Transitive Closure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - LoopException

      • saveScheme

        public java.lang.String saveScheme(java.lang.String filePath)
        Realization of save the Scheme to the given file by user.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to save the Scheme
        Returns:
        JSON String with the Scheme

      • loadScheme

        public void loadScheme(java.lang.String filePath)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Realization of load the Scheme from the given file by user.
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the file, which will be loading
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On input error.
        See Also:
        IOException
